website_summaries.verdict: Classic Accessories is a trusted, reliable brand, and this is everything you need for a casual fishing experience.
pros: It's lightweight at 43 pounds, making it relatively easy to carry
There's armrest storage that includes two large zippered pockets and weather protection fabric
It's also made out of tough material
cons: There aren't a lot of fancy perks
Also, the seat is plastic and not as comfortable as what you might find from more expensive units

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic Boat - I don't miss my Jon Boat any more!
customer_reviews.text: I love this pontoon boat. If I had any negative to say it concerns the inflation pressure. You are told not to inflate above 2.4PSI They should offer a way of telling how to guess-tamate without a gauge. Also, if the 2.4PSI is without a person sitting in it. I ordered a gauge even though none of the gauges have a very good review. Other than that I love this boat and have now modified it to accept a hand operated trolling motor
customer_reviews.author: Kelvin SubZ

customer_reviews.title: Light and durable
customer_reviews.text: Just used this boat for a float trip last month and functioned really well. Only drawback is the oar stoppers, had to reinforce them to prevent slippage, overall a good unit, light and durable
customer_reviews.author: Marc Oliver

customer_reviews.title: This is a bare bones entry level pontoon. Ideally ...
customer_reviews.text: This is a bare bones entry level pontoon. Ideally one should buy a pressure gauge with a double action hand pump to inflate the pontoons to the correct pressure. However, I think that this pontoon is unsuitable for a total load of more than 200 pounds. I know the pontoon is rated to 350 pounds, but when the water is cold and the air in the pontoons start to decrease in pressure, the pontoons can very quickly 'deflate' and cause balance problems. Overall, I do think that it is a value for money product, just don't expect too much from it.
customer_reviews.author: GoPlanetBlue

customer_reviews.title: perfect for easy slowe water
customer_reviews.text: i use this to get to certain secret spots in slow water.. would notrecommend this for first timers..but for the experienced, it just needs a few modifications like i for example used duct tape to help keep the paddles from slipping and sliding with their oar stopper rings which tend to slide easily ..so that is the most important issue otherwise great for shore line poolin
customer_reviews.author: maywefishnow

customer_reviews.title: Good value
customer_reviews.text: Very pleased with overall quality of the boat. Frame is lighter than standard boats which makes it easy to move around. Not too sure about the strength of the light frame. Oars are only 6 feet and are lighter than standard. This is a bare-bones boat at a very good price.
customer_reviews.author: Michael S

customer_reviews.title: THIS IS VERY NICE, BROTHERS
customer_reviews.text: I love this! It’s light, easy to assemble and disassemble, durable, and affordable. I would recommend this to anyone who wants to enhance their fishing experience. Rawr xD
customer_reviews.author: Mighty D.

customer_reviews.title: Big, bulky, and barely white water rated.
customer_reviews.text: I get beat by my inflatable kayak friends every time setting this thing up and theirs takes up less room in the car. It has so many connectors that should have been made able to fold and stay connected for easier storage and make it easier to put together. Most other inflatables this price range come with pumps included, this one does not. Waiting for an adapter to inflate it with a bike pump to make it easier. I love the way it looks and having a sturdy chair to sit in was the main reason for the purchase other then in inflatable. Kindof second guessing that.
customer_reviews.author: Coleman Anderson

customer_reviews.title: The corrugated cardboard container it came in is sturdy enough to reuse
customer_reviews.text: Light enough to carry in a wagon behind a bicycle to the fishing hole. We're considering leaving it inflated and strapping it to the roof of the car for next season though because it does take more than 10 minutes to inflate with your lungs. And yes, we do have a portable inflationary device but it's just more weight in the wagon. Having the seat in the boat, with foot rests, makes for a relaxing float on a lake or wide river. The corrugated cardboard container it came in is sturdy enough to reuse.
customer_reviews.author: Cheryl57

customer_reviews.title: Trash
customer_reviews.text: I weigh 180lbs, well under the 350 weight limit, and first day out the weight of my legs bent the foot rests, and using the oars in a class one river BENT ONE IN HALF in the first 2 minutes. I could have died avoiding trying to avoid the hazard in the river due to the crap quality of these oars. Oh, and the oarlock bushings wore out after one trip down a river, easy 7 mile float. So many components of this boat are garbage I would NEVER buy it again. Oh and I just barely missed the return window.
customer_reviews.author: Ryan DeLuca

customer_reviews.title: that i got this incomplete
customer_reviews.text: Will I never had one of this pontoon I purchased one and my surprise when I open the box it had a big hall on the middle of the box when I opened it parts was missing so I never got to used is so I sand it back but I want one of this so bad bc they tell me is so fun so am going to purchase another one to see if this time comes complete
customer_reviews.author: Hannah

customer_reviews.title: Great little boat for a great price
customer_reviews.text: Just what I was looking for. Easy to assemble and transport, not too heavy. If you're looking for more bells and whistles then you probably want to step up to the the Colorado, but this is a great budget boat. FYI - the inflation valves on the pontoons are the same as what are on inflatable paddle boards. In fact, I use my paddle board pump to pump this up. Most iSUP pumps are double action (pump air on the up stroke as well as the down stroke) and all have pressure gauges. No guessing necessary.
customer_reviews.author: Rachel C.

customer_reviews.title: Oars were both broken
customer_reviews.text: I purchased 2 of these pontoon boats at the same time. I received the quickly and I assembled them the same day I received them. One pontoon boat is perfect. The other came with 2 broken oars. I do not want to return the pontoon boat. It was too much work assembling it and I don’t want to waste time disassembling this to return it. It will cost everyone more money and time to do that. I just want a set of oars that are not broken. Please send me 2 new oars. Thank you.
customer_reviews.author: Gia Diep

customer_reviews.title: the O rings on the oars slide very easily when paddling and are completely useless
customer_reviews.text: Ive used it once so far and its not quite what i thought it would be. maybe because im 210lbs but it does not float as high up as i thought, kinda half sunk at full inflation. the back storage where i set my back pack was submerged and my things got soaked. the oars are just too long and creates a very wide range making it hard to "go" and get around small obstacles. the O rings on the oars slide very easily when paddling and are completely useless. i may try and sell this or modify it, haven't decided yet.
customer_reviews.author: Rucifer

customer_reviews.title: The boat is great the oars are not
customer_reviews.text: Unless your only use it to paddle around lakes your probably fine, however if you end up taking it on anything with a current I would advise you buy some better oars, one of my oars broke in half when paddling up stream, I was carried off by the current and had to wait to reach the bank before i could get out.
customer_reviews.author: Corey M. O'Connell

customer_reviews.title: well packed and easy to understand instructions how to put together.
customer_reviews.text: this is shipped in a good solid box and well packaged to prevent any damage due to its weight. light weight for a 8 foot pontoon. heavy canvas material and light weight tubing and fold down plastic seat. the seat is more supportive than the canvas fold down type that adjust with straps on each side that interfere with movements. I could have rated better but I have not been able to try it on water yet this spring.
customer_reviews.author: clinton zell

customer_reviews.title: Easy to carry
customer_reviews.text: Thanks a lot I can get all the small areas where the big boats can’t go and it’s easily portable I can carry it with backpack straps good product thank you very much
customer_reviews.author: fred

customer_reviews.title: Affordable pontoon that works very well.
customer_reviews.text: Nice pontoon for the money. Kept me high and dry on the lake I was fishing on. Only problem is that the pontoons seemed to tie in off center making access to the storage bags on both sides a little difficult to get into. Anybody out there have a solution?
customer_reviews.author: tim loomis

customer_reviews.title: You get what you pay for
customer_reviews.text: The oars are absolute junk other than that you get what you pay for
customer_reviews.author: Alexandra Woolley

customer_reviews.title: Good for the price
customer_reviews.text: It's small and you are a high profile object on the water so any amount of wind sends you flying and makes it difficult to paddle against a current or the wind. You'll definitely want a little anchor. Being small makes it more difficult to keep the boat straight. On the other hand, if you are able to keep the frame in one piece when you transport it, this is a piece of cake to put together. I'm looking at getting a pad for the seat because it can get uncomfortable after a couple hours on the lake.
customer_reviews.author: Distance

customer_reviews.title: Very happy so far but it's still too cold here to ...
customer_reviews.text: No tools required! Seems very well made and a cinch to assembly. Very happy so far but it's still too cold here to take it out to the lake. I choose this pontoon as it's only 43 pounds and I need to get it there by myself.
customer_reviews.author: Jill S.

customer_reviews.title: Weak Where it Matters.
customer_reviews.text: Less than 15 minutes on the water, and the oars were bent. The frame is solid and strong, seams appear well done. If you are anything but the weakest of rowers, upgrade your oars.
customer_reviews.author: Jesse Spurgeon

customer_reviews.title: this worked great for fishing and relaxing in the lake
customer_reviews.text: I am a big guy, about 240 lbs, this worked great for fishing and relaxing in the lake. Best of all, easy to put in a backpack compared to a canoe or kayak. Keep two in my truck all of the time for my wife and I.
customer_reviews.author: Anonymous Me

customer_reviews.title: Really good, simple boat for the price.
customer_reviews.text: This is a good little boat. Used it all summer in the river and it is holding up well. My only complaint is that the rings that are supposed to hold the oars in place tend to slide around. A couple wraps of tape fixed it though. Might want a padded seat for long floats, but it is still pretty comfortable.
customer_reviews.author: David

customer_reviews.title: Great little boat!
customer_reviews.text: Good entry-level pontoon boat, functional with no many bells and whistles. Oar lock system could use some work, but for the price, it gets the job done.
customer_reviews.author: Steve

customer_reviews.title: Great pontoon boat for the price
customer_reviews.text: Great pontoon boat for the price. Very well constructed. Easy and fast to assemble. Way better quality than I expected.
customer_reviews.author: OregonMike

customer_reviews.title: Awesome
customer_reviews.text: Absolutely Love It!! Well worth the price. Very portable. Fits in a duffle bag.
customer_reviews.author: Mathew Starcher

customer_reviews.title: Four Stars
customer_reviews.text: I really like this pontoon, but the oars suck when needing to stay in place.
customer_reviews.author: Shelby Carlson

customer_reviews.title: The pontoons itself is good quality but having the oar break that easuly out ...
customer_reviews.text: Left Oar broke after 30 minutes. The pontoons itself is good quality but having the oar break that easuly out in the middle of the lake really is a pain. It's an important feature to the pontoons itself and having it break like that after such short use
customer_reviews.author: Hodin

customer_reviews.title: Poor durability. Began leaking great amounts of air from major seams on its maiden voyage...
customer_reviews.text: Major seams on both pontoon floats began leaking considerably when on the water. Length of paddles also made it very cumbersome to maneuver.
customer_reviews.author: Charles Combs

customer_reviews.title: The oars are really flimsy and do not come with ...
customer_reviews.text: The oars are really flimsy and do not come with oar locks. Also, it is not as stable as I had hoped.
customer_reviews.author: coloradoweezy

customer_reviews.title: Love it
customer_reviews.text: Very easy to assemble best affordable blow up boat ever
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Don't waste your money
customer_reviews.text: Buoyancy is poor. You best best be built like a body builder if you are going to row this all day.
customer_reviews.author: Disappointed

customer_reviews.title: Great for the money
customer_reviews.text: Great on small lakes easy to put together my son loves it
customer_reviews.author: Dad angers

customer_reviews.title: Pontoon boat wonderful
customer_reviews.text: Loved how easy it was to assemble. Instructions were easy to read and understand.
customer_reviews.author: Sandra Willis

customer_reviews.title: Does not retain air on water.
customer_reviews.text: Was on the water and left pontoon deflated to the point I had the paddle for my life back to shore. They do not retain air very well. The water was 60 degrees and still went flat. Air valves are cheap and poorly designed. They release about 15% of pressure when trying to seal after blowing up. Oar locks are not tight and oars slide. Could be great product just a few cheap design flaws that pushed me to return product and look for higher quality.
customer_reviews.author: Ryan Ruud

customer_reviews.title: Great buy, quality item.
customer_reviews.text: The size of my fish doubled as soon as I got this. Great buy. Quality item.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Got this for my husband for Christmas. He absolutely loves it!
customer_reviews.author: jessica

customer_reviews.title: Solid pontoon
customer_reviews.text: Someone who loves to get out on the water and fish new places without of truck this pontoon is amazing. It fits in the trunk of a VW Jetta with ease. A few snaps, clicks and air and you are r day to hit the water. The simple fishermans dream. Rowing can be challenging but can be learned. On windy days don't forget your anchor! I say... BUY it or get the upgrade for a little more cash.
customer_reviews.author: Shaun

customer_reviews.title: it is not good in a river or where there is a current
customer_reviews.text: hard to row and keep straight. it is not good in a river or where there is a current.
customer_reviews.author: Peggy S. Verda

customer_reviews.title: Pontoon fail
customer_reviews.text: Left side pontoon leaked from first day. Oars are too long and too heavy especially when they filled with water..
customer_reviews.author: denise roeder-rivera

customer_reviews.title: The Pontoon is easy to assemble and inflate and makes fishing fun
customer_reviews.text: The Pontoon is easy to assemble and inflate and makes fishing fun. I would recommend it to those who don't want to haul a heavy boat, but want to fish.
customer_reviews.author: Stanley Renton

customer_reviews.title: The inflatable was very comfortable, however a better oar locks are needed with ...
customer_reviews.text: The inflatable was very comfortable, however a better oar locks are needed with this product. The oars were awkward to control.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Perfect size and portability
customer_reviews.text: Perfect size for the river. Easy to transport, inflate and deflate. Only thing missing is something to store it in.
customer_reviews.author: Kurt Falk

customer_reviews.title: Broken valve
customer_reviews.text: Over all good but arrived with a broken valve... Had to order a new one...
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Roanoke - Great Pontoon Boat
customer_reviews.text: As a first time buyer and only an annual user for floating a river I chose this boat mostly for the price. Of all the boats that appeared at our camp I think this one was the best, even compared to other CA boats. I really like that the seat is higher so you don't sit in the water. It was easy to put together. There was a slight problem with the oars not fitting together but we managed to make it work. One more thing... for some reason it is fast. I had a hard time staying with the pack, it just wanted to run away!
customer_reviews.author: Compelled to review

customer_reviews.title: Easy to assemble came well packaged
customer_reviews.text: Oar broke on second day of use brought new meaning to being up the creek without a paddle! Easy to assemble came well packaged.
customer_reviews.author: Mr B.

customer_reviews.title: The quality of the unit is good, but the valves are horrible
customer_reviews.text: The quality of the unit is good, but the valves are horrible. Could not get the valve closed fast enough before 15%-20% of the air escaped. This feature needs to be redesigned.
customer_reviews.author: Christopher Thompson

customer_reviews.title: This is a great way to fish if your by yourself and need ...
customer_reviews.text: This is a great way to fish if your by yourself and need to get on the water. This is a good device for the money and easy to manuever and use. Excellent way to go. Fish on!!
customer_reviews.author: Lyle W.

customer_reviews.title: Great!
customer_reviews.text: My son loves this and everyone who sees it is amazed. He bought a small anchor to hold him in place
customer_reviews.author: Dottie

customer_reviews.title: it looks like a decent quality raft for the price
customer_reviews.text: Haven't used yet however, it looks like a decent quality raft for the price. No bells and whistles but, I didn't expect any for the price.
customer_reviews.author: WV Woodsman

customer_reviews.title: great. as long as the waters aren't to rough
customer_reviews.text: Not made for strong waters..for a pond or Lake .great.as long as the waters aren't to rough.
customer_reviews.author: Alberto

customer_reviews.title: First time I took the boat out I broke the ...
customer_reviews.text: First time I took the boat out I broke the leg piece off and bent the oar framework is not very steady
customer_reviews.author: steven

customer_reviews.title: Four Stars
customer_reviews.text: Waiting for warm weather. Can't wait. Have seen them and they appear to be quite stable.
customer_reviews.author: Tim O'Leary

customer_reviews.title: Great little pontoon
customer_reviews.text: Great little pontoon. I use it for fishing the New River. Easy to carry lite weight. I rigged it up with fishing pole holders.
customer_reviews.author: NewRiverrats

customer_reviews.title: Amazon a Joy
customer_reviews.text: Works well, easy to assemble...Experience with Amazon was second to none!
customer_reviews.author: MacGyver

customer_reviews.title: Yes. It inflated, floats, and we will ...
customer_reviews.text: Yes. It inflated ,floats,and we will see if it holds up!
customer_reviews.author: Echo caffey

product_meta.title: Classic Accessories Roanoke Inflatable Pontoon Boat
feature_bullets: Roanoke assembled size: 96"L x 55"W x 29"H, Weight: 43 lbs.
Heavy-duty pontoons with abrasion-resistant PVC bottoms and tough nylon tops
Nimble and reliable 8-foot pontoon boat is lightweight and easy to manuever
Armrest storage includes two large zippered pockets and weather protection
Armrest storage includes two large zippered pockets and small mesh stuff pockets
Fabric rear storage platform, mesh under seat apron
Lightweight and easy to maneuver, Durable plastic fold down seat
Footrests adjust to a wide range of leg lengths, Rides high for improved visibility
